text: Indian equity benchmarks climbed for the third trading session, led automakers ahead of their September sales data.The S&P BSE Sensex Index rose as much as 1.1 percent to 31,615, while the NSE Nifty 50 Index rose as much as 1.1 percent to 9,895. The market breadth was firmly tilted in favour of buyers. All the 19 sector gauges compiled by BSE advanced, led by the S&P BSE Auto Index's 1.7 percent jump.
title: Stocks Radar: Dr. Reddy’s Lab,  Reliance Communications, SpiceJet, Tata Motors
